units.title: Cell and bead co-encapsulation
units.text: We found that on average, 91.4% of all droplets contain a cell and a bead, and only 1.7% contain an independent cell doublet (Fig. 1f).
units.rationale: This is a quantified, actionable step in the protocol describing co-encapsulation efficiency.

units.title: Cell capture efficiency measurement
units.text: We processed cell numbers of between 50 and 200 cells, of which 74.9% (s.d. ±10.7%) of input cells had more than 500 unique molecular identifiers (UMIs) per cell (Fig. 1j).
units.rationale: This describes a specific protocol step for evaluating cell capture performance with quantified metrics.

units.title: Impedance-based cell counting
units.text: We quantified the number of input cells using impedance measurements, which enabled accurate counting of the number of input cells as validated by microscopy (Extended Data Fig. 2f).
units.rationale: This is a precise methodological step for input cell quantification, critical for protocol reproducibility.

units.title: Droplet generation and valve control
units.text: The important points are the implementation of Quake-style microvalves to facilitate flow control during operation; the development of a machine-vision-based approach utilizing subsequent image subtraction for blob detection; the induction of deterministic particle displacement patterns to move particles into the target region of interest with 95.9% of particles placed in a ~200-μm-wide region; and the precise pressurization of the dropleting valve to enable accurate control of droplet volume.
units.rationale: This summarizes key operational steps for device control and droplet generation, essential for protocol execution.

units.title: cDNA generation protocol
units.text: Initially, as a library quality measure, we performed a species mixing experiment of human embryonic kidney (HEK) 293T and murine immortalized brown pre-adipocyte (IBA) cells.
units.rationale: This describes a specific protocol step for validating library quality using a controlled mixing experiment.

units.title: Time-dependent cell processing assessment
units.text: We also assessed time-dependent effects on the quality of the single cell data by analyzing HEK 293T cells that were loaded on our system (at 22 °C (room temperature)) for 0–20, 20–40 and 40–60 min. Furthermore, we sampled cells that were stored for 120 and 180 min on ice.
units.rationale: This outlines a protocol for evaluating the impact of processing time on cell integrity, a critical validation step.

units.title: Comparison with Fluidigm C1 platform
units.text: We performed similar experiments involving 38, 125 and 215 HEK 293T cells on DisCo’s closest competitor system for low cell input samples: the Fluidigm C1 platform (Table 1). We chose the 96-trap chip given that, according to the user manual, it is the more suitable chip for low cell inputs.
units.rationale: This describes a direct comparative protocol step to benchmark DisCo against an established system.

units.title: Organoid processing with DisCo
units.text: In total, we processed 31 single organoids using DisCo at four developmental time points after symmetry breaking, and identified striking differences in cell type composition between individual organoids.
units.rationale: This is a concrete protocol step describing sample processing and experimental design on organoids.

units.title: Barcode merging for low-bead samples
units.text: We were able to improve the detectable number of transcripts per cell as compared with published Drop-seq data-sets on HEK 293T cells by exploiting the uniquely low number of beads in DisCo samples (<500), which enabled us to identify and merge closely related barcodes (described in Methods) without compromising single cell purity.
units.rationale: This describes a specific data processing protocol step enabled by DisCo’s low-bead design.

units.title: Cell concentration and processing speed adjustment
units.text: At a higher cell concentration of 20 cells per μl, the processing speed could be increased to 350 cells per hour, although with a decreased capture efficiency of approximately 75%.
units.rationale: This provides an actionable protocol parameter for optimizing throughput versus efficiency.
